h3.span: Welcome to the Westborough Public Schools

img.title: AB
img.style: border-width: 8px; border-style: solid; float: left; border-color: rgb(255, 255, 255); width: 90px; height: 111px;

p.style: color: rgb(34, 34, 34); font-family: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: small; line-height: 1.38; margin-top: 0pt; margin-bottom: 0pt;

span.style: font-size: 11pt; background-color: transparent; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap; font-family: Arial; color: rgb(0, 0, 0);
font-family: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 13px; color: rgb(34, 34, 34);
font-size: 11pt; background-color: transparent; white-space: pre-wrap; font-family: Arial; color: rgb(0, 0, 0);

p.span: It has been just over 4 weeks since we closed our schools and began this long journey of social distancing and a new virtual lifestyle for educating children, working from home, and socializing via zoom with family and friends. It has been emotionally exhausting for all of us. At the same time, it has been amazing to see our community positively respond to coping with such unprecedented issues.

span.style: font-size: 11pt; background-color: transparent; white-space: pre-wrap; font-family: Arial; color: rgb(0, 0, 0);

p.span: Outlined below I have updates on a series of recent questions.

p.style: color: rgb(34, 34, 34); font-family: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: small; margin-bottom: 10px;

span.style: background-color: transparent; font-size: 11pt; font-weight: 700; white-space: pre-wrap; font-family: Arial; color: rgb(0, 0, 0);

p.style: color: rgb(34, 34, 34); font-family: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: small; line-height: 1.38; margin-top: 0pt; margin-bottom: 0pt;

span.style: font-size: 11pt; background-color: transparent; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap; font-family: Arial; color: rgb(0, 0, 0);

p.span: Most importantly, people want to understand why Westborough has planned to maintain our school calendar and take next week’s April vacation as scheduled. I certainly appreciate the varied perspectives on this and there are two key reasons driving this decision. The first reason is to provide time for faculty to rest, regroup on their planning, and to attend to their own families. Unlike the majority of districts around us who took two weeks off before starting to provide learning opportunities to students at home, our ALD learning platform was up and functional three days after schools closed. Westborough teachers have been developing a new instructional model, learning to use new software, and actively implementing daily work for three weeks while managing their own family stresses. It is my professional opinion that for them to effectively maintain this model for an extended amount of time, that they will benefit from time to plan and regroup. Secondly, with such uncertainty regarding when and if school will reopen, we do not want to compromise the potential days in June where we may have the opportunity to gain valuable time with students if the state allows us to return to school.

span.style: font-family: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 13px; color: rgb(34, 34, 34);
